comments:
RC2, Suse, GTK driver 
 
I created an extsh connection to the Eclipse repository and tried to extract 
all the org.* project (205 in total). 
After about 20 minutes the progress was at about 1/3 of the entire job. 
I left my desk and when I got back about five minutes later I noticed that 
error dialog (Problems encountered while performing check out) with the rror 
message: 
 
:Terminated with fatal signal 11 
 
BTW, for performance improvements, it will be better to not update the progress 
monitor on every file checked out, especially when the number of files is over 
some treshold value.

Last project, partially checked out, was org.eclipse.ui.workbench. 
I also have the CVS decorators turned on. 
 
All the fully checked out projects have a [dev.eclipse.org] suffix, while the 
org.eclipse.ui.workbench does not.

Here is what I see in the .log file: 
!SESSION Mar 11, 2003 10:42:14.331

I removed all the projects and repeated the full checkout operation, but this 
time I deselected the "Perform builds automatically on resource modification" 
in the Workbench properties. 
I got the same error. It looks like the build is still triggered.

I've tried similar operations (i.e. most but not all Eclipse projects) and have 
not encountered errors. We'll investigate for RC3.

I've seen similar errors occur when file compression was on. Did you set the 
CVS file compression preference to something other than 0?

Yes, as I was playing with the preference settings, I had set the compression 
level to 9.

Then that is the cause of the error (known CVS bug). However, we should 
probably recover better. Will investigate in 2.2

Checkout error recovering was improved in early 3.1 such that a failure in a 
project will leave the project shared but partially populated.
